text: General elections were held in Sweden on 20 September 1970,Nohlen, D & Stöver, P (2010) Elections in Europe: A data handbook, p1858 two years ahead of schedule because of the opening of the newly unicameral Riksdag. The Social Democratic remained the largest party, winning 163 of the 350 seats and gathered enough support to remain in power under its 1969 elected leader, Prime Minister Olof Palme. ==Results== {| class=wikitable style=text- align:right |- |colspan=7|300px |- !Party !Votes !% !Seats !+/– |- |align=left|Swedish Social Democratic Party||2,256,369||45.3||163||+38 |- |align=left|Centre Party||991,208||19.9||71||+32 |- |align=left|People's Party||806,667||16.2||58||+24 |- |align=left|Moderate Party||573,812||11.5||41||+9 |- |align=left|Left Party Communists||236,659||4.8||17||+14 |- |align=left|Christian Democratic Unity||88,770||1.8||0||0 |- |align=left|Communist League Marxist–Leninist||21,238||0.4||0||New |- |align=left|Other parties||1,473||0.0||0||0 |- |align=left|Invalid/blank votes||8,011||–||–||– |- |align=left|Total||4,984,207||100||350||+117 |- |align=left|Registered voters/turnout||5,645,804||88.3||–||– |- |align=left colspan=5|Source: Nohlen & Stöver |} ==References== 1970 Category:1970 elections in Sweden Category:September 1970 events in Europe
title: 1970 Swedish general election
